title: Adopting a Pet and What to Know About Australian Labradoodles
summary: Australian Labradoodles are a type of hybrid-breed dog that result from cross-breeding the labrador retriever and the standard poodle. The labradoodle is a medium-sized dog, with an average weight of 55-75 pounds when fully grown. They are extremely versatile and can be trained for many different activities, including therapy work and guide work. The Animal Protection Society of New York recommends that only adults adopt pets. Adopting an animal is a serious commitment that requires a large amount of time and effort.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Adopting a pet from an animal shelter is a great way to bring love and companionship into your home. It\u2019t also a kind and selfless act, as you are giving another creature a second chance at life. However, adopting a pet can be quite the ordeal. You must first understand the ins and outs of owning pets, choose whether you want to adopt an adult or juvenile animal, narrow down your selection of potential pets by checking their housing requirements, veterinarian references and character traits, and finally interview prospective pets before bringing them home with you.
There are many different types of animals that you can adopt as a pet. Read on to find out more about adopting an Australian labradoodle as your new pet!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: What Are the Benefits of Mediation for Families?

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Mediation is an alternative dispute resolution process. It\u2019s a way of resolving disputes that is less adversarial than litigation and usually cheaper, faster, and more private than other methods. Mediation is also collaborative as well as neutral. The mediator acts as a neutral party who helps the parties attempt to resolve their dispute in a fair and equitable manner.
In mediation, both parties together with their respective attorneys choose from various options to settle the case outside of court. The goal of mediation is to find solutions that are agreeable to both parties. It\u2019s about finding win-win solutions instead of win-lose outcomes. It\u2019s about exploring solutions that may not have been considered had the parties not been under the guidance of a mediator who has no stake in either outcome of the dispute other than seeing it resolved amicably and fairly so that everyone walks away feeling like they have gained something from it rather than having given up something they would rather have kept.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Deal with a Partner Who's Always on Social Media

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`According to recent analysis by Statista, the average millennial spends almost one hour every day on social media. That\u2019s not just posting pictures and updating our profiles, but also lurking on other people\u2019s profiles. The rise of dating apps like Tinder, Bumble, and Happn has only hastened this tendency. In fact, an article in Fast Company suggests that millennials are so preoccupied with online dating that they now spend more time on it than on any other leisure activity besides watching TV or listening to music.
On top of all this, many couples now meet their partners online \u2013 a third of marriages in the U.S. start with either partner meeting their future spouse through an online dating site or app. While it\u2019s easy to feel pressured into signing up for these services if you don\u2019t have friends who are single and looking for love, being in a relationship with someone who does use them regularly can be challenging at times.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Ways to Make Your Mornings Easier

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`You know those people who seem to get out of bed with ease every morning? You know, the people that you see on Instagram and wonder how they\u2019re so happy so early in the day? Well, we hate to break it to you but those people have their own set of problems. Getting up after a long night is hard for them too; the only difference is that their solutions work.
These people have their own rituals and habits when it comes to waking up in the morning. If these folks can do it then why can\u2019t we? It\u2019s because some of us are too comfortable, which means we need to shake things up! Do you want to be one of those people who gets out of bed with ease and has a productive day ahead of them? In this blog post, we\u2019ll tell you 5 ways you can make your mornings easier.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Easy Ways to Make Your Home More Energy Efficient

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`As the cost of living continues to rise, it\u2019s more important than ever for Americans to find ways to save money and stay within a budget. After all, no one wants to feel like they\u2019re drowning in bills every month.
To that end, everyone could probably stand to tighten their belts a little bit when it comes to their day-to-day expenses; after all, there are several small things we can do on a daily basis that will collectively add up and help us save money in the long run. In this blog post, we\u2019ll cover everything you need to know about energy efficiency at home and how you can start saving money by making your house more efficient today!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog Not to Chew on Household Items

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Are you ready to give up chewing on household objects? How about your dog? Dogs love to chew. It\u2019s something that comes naturally for them, and there are many things you can buy or make that will help satisfy their natural instincts to chew. But as much as dogs love to have objects that they can gnaw on, it\u2019s not always safe \u2013 or advisable \u2013 to let them do it in the home. There are plenty of household items that dogs shouldn\u2019t be allowed to chew, because it could lead to potential hazards or unsanitary conditions.
Even if your dog has never chewed on inappropriate things before, a new puppy will almost certainly try out things beyond what is safe for him. How you train him from the very beginning will determine how much damage he can do if he goes after something he shouldn\u2019t. So read on and learn how to stop your dog from chewing on anything other than his own toys.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: From First Date to Soulmate: How to Know If You're on the Right Track

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`There are so many first date horror stories out there \u2014 awkward silences, strange amateur- magician tricks, and cringe-worthy pick-up lines being just a few of them. But getting past these awkward initial stages and finding a potential partner who you can connect with on a deeper level is no mean feat. Figuring out if someone is your soulmate or simply the first step to becoming one isn\u2019t easy. Even though it can feel like we\u2019re constantly being bombarded with images of fairy tale love and meet-cute romances, dating in real life isn\u2019t always so straightforward. Unless you\u2019re living under a rock, you probably know that letting somebody into your private world isn\u2019t something to take lightly.
But how do you know if you\u2019re on the right track when it comes to dating? Whether you\u2019ve just met someone new and want to get to know them better without rushing things or have been seeing somebody for some time and are wondering if they could be The One, here are some signs that could indicate that this person may be more than just a casual partner\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog to Wait

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Mediation is a great way to resolve your legal dispute, but it\u2019s not right for everyone. If you\u2019re eligible to mediate, that might depend on the type of case you have and who you are. For example, there may be other requirements that you meet to qualify as an eligible candidate.
Mediation eligibility can differ depending on whether the dispute resolution program requires participants to be from a certain income level or has other prerequisites such as being a homeowner or having a specific legal status. You should also keep in mind that some programs may require mediation only when parties can\u2019t agree on a settlement and not necessarily as an initial step in their process for resolving disputes. Read on for more information about who can mediate and what factors may impact your ability to participate in this alternative dispute resolution process.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Easy Tips for Sticking to Your New Year's Resolutions

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"New Year\u2019s resolutions are like a clean slate for the coming year. What you do with that opportunity is up to you. Maybe you resolve to eat healthier, exercise more or reduce stress and anxiety. Maybe you decide to learn a new skill, read more books, help others or travel more. Or maybe your resolution is to do something completely different \u2014 like learn a language, stop procrastinating or read the complete works of Shakespeare. The possibilities are endless, but sticking to those resolutions can be challenging. The key is establishing habits that will last all 365 days of the year and not just one crazy day in January. It takes small but deliberate changes in everyday life that add up over time and become second nature. Here are 10 easy tips for sticking to your New Year\u2019s resolutions:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
